channel.title: 2009 Iran Election and protest
channel.description:
So the shit seems to have hit the fan majorly in Iran, with massive protests and riots after the Elections seemed to have been rigged so that Mahmoud Ahmadinejad won. It's pretty clear with hundreds of thousands of people taking to the streets to protest he didn't win.
Really interesting and amazing to see everything unfolding on Twitter after the govt tried to block most of the social media sites and blocked SMS, MMS and general phone coverage. People managed to find proxies and what not to allow people to use Twitter, and although it's illegal, thankfully a lot of Iranians have satellite dishes that they are trying to use.
Here are some links to Twitter feeds and a bunch of news articles.
[url]https://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8103269.stm[/url] [url]https://iran.twazzup.com/[/url] (grabs twitters with certain tags) [url]https://www.boston.com/bigpicture/2009/0[/url] ... ction.html [url]https://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/w[/url] ... 505842.ece [url]https://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,526540,00.html[/url] [url]https://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast[/url] ... index.html
The first E-Revolution.

Filming kids punching someone and running away is hardly the same thing.
The article I was talking about was down for a while, now the link is back up.

You missed the parts where it’s been taken to the level of beating people to death while filming it then I take it.

UK chav culture, sadly: Happy Slapping

“Jackass” and Middle-Eastern riots are hardly the same, Bean.
Not to mention that “Jackasses” film how they beat others, but those in Iran - how they are being beaten.

item.title: 2009 Iran Election and protest
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
mattemuse:

I read an interesting article last week that seemed to predict this - it was something about how Shiia have a thing for blood (that religious ritual where they cut/whip themselves) so they are uploading cell phone videos of how badly they are being beaten at these protests as a form of bragging rights. Not that the dead girl was showing off, but like others have commented, what kind of culture films that kind of thing so thoroughly?

UK chav culture, sadly: Happy Slapping

Read full topic

item.title: 2009 Iran Election and protest
item.dc:creator: ultrasvin
item.description:
Saeed Mortazavi: butcher of the press - and torturer of Tehran?

The Iranian regime has appointed one of its most feared prosecutors to interrogate reformists arrested during demonstrations, prompting fears of a brutal crackdown against dissent.

https://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/middle_east/article6570089.ece

item.title: 2009 Iran Election and protest
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
It’s the official policy of the US Department of Defense that protests are considered
“low-level terrorism”

not only in US, though
And, IMHO, not “low-level terrorism”, but “potential terrorism”.

item.title: 2009 Iran Election and protest
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Well, lest we in the United States get too high-and-mighty about freedom of protest:

It’s the official policy of the US Department of Defense that protests are considered
“low-level terrorism”

https://www.aclu.org/images/general/asset_upload_file89_39820.pdf

I wish I was surprised by that…

Read full topic

* Rule 5:
DON’T CLAIM THE MORAL OR INTELLECTUAL HIGH GROUND ANYWHERE!
